page.title: 09Industry in Paddock Wood
page.content: The Industrial Estates in Paddock Wood are situated on the northern outskirts of the village.There are 2 main complexes,Eldon Way and the P.W. Distribution Centre.There are 24 firms on the Eldon Way Estate,most of whom have been there since 1975.The big names include K.S.D.Services,Bond Deliveries and British Car Auctions. Transfesa/P.W.D.C. are industries concerned with fruit and storage. Transfesa itself is a Spanish firm basedin Madrid.It imports and distributes fruit and vegetables. Transfesa is situated on the railway it also uses lorries.The buildings cover 30 000 square metres. The P.W.D.C.includes a bottling plant, storage firms for Marks & Spencer,Mid Kent Water Board and many other small firms.Halls,a wood factory,has been in the village since 1935.
